legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: 911 Alternative Model Study and Strategic Plan
summary_description: Develop a strategic plan on 911 alternative response models
program_description: The Justice Advisory Council will engage consultants to develop a report and strategic plan on 911 alternative response models for Cook County. This includes 1) a comprehensive analysis of Cook County's current 911 system, 2) best and emerging practices in putting in place alternative responses, and 3) recommendations and a strategic plan on how Cook County may move forward with a new model. The goal of this project is to develop a plan for a response system that both better responds with mental health and other emergency services that do not require a traditional law enforcement response, needs which have been exacerbated during the lengthy pandemic, and to prevent unnecessary involvement of individuals in the criminal justice system.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Piloting new approaches to 911 call diversion
program_description: Improves the City's response to 911 calls by piloting new approaches to 911 call diversion, alternate response models, and establishing alternate destinations for patient transport
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Purchasing and retiring medical debt of income-eligible patients in Cook County hospitals
program_description: Cook County will support the development of a Community Information Exchange (CIE) for suburban Cook County and the City of Chicago to enhance the 211 system already being collaboratively developed by Cook County, the City of Chicago and a range of partners. A CIE is an interconnected and linked network of health, behavioral health, human, and social service providers that share information and coordinate services so that an individual receives the whole person care they need to be healthy and thrive, regardless of how they initially enter services, creating a “no wrong door” access to the social and health services system.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Access and awareness for public support services
summary_description: Community-based navigation resources for public services
program_description: Provides community-based navigation resources to ensure residents are aware of and have access to public services, including the creation of a 211 system
agency: Department of Family and Support Services
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan
Reviewed: KR - this was segmented out into 2 rows. Condensed into 1 row and confirmed amount on city dashboard

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
program: Acquisition rehab program for small/mid-sized buildings
summary_description: Restoration of troubled and abandoned homes
program_description: Identifies and restores troubled and abandoned homes and buildings in priority neighborhoods to support community investment
source: City of Chicago

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Advancing equitable recovery in the Southland/building capacity in the Southland
summary_description: Small business growth programs
program_description: The Southland Development Authority (SDA) drives comprehensive, transformative and inclusive economic growth in Cook County’s South Suburbs. Funding will allow the SDA to continue to support the small business growth programs to advance key sectors.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Grants for students and households to cover school supplies
program_description: Provides flexible grants for Chicago students/households to cover school supplies, food, and other essentials that are required for student support
agency: Chicago Office of Budget and Management
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: American Rescue Plan Capital Assets Program
summary_description: Support improvements and investments in commecial corridors and downtowns
program_description: To support improvements and encourage investment in commercial corridors and downtowns that have experienced disinvestment, particularly in communities hardest hit by COVID-19. Through this program, DCEO can fund projects that make these areas more attractive for private investment, generate short-term and long-term employment opportunities, and improve quality of life in the community through high-quality infrastructure and amenities.
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Targeted relief for individual artists and cultural organizations not eligible for other federal relief programs
program_description: Targeted relief for individual artists and cultural organizations not eligible for other federal relief programs
agency: Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Funds for businesses for revenue loss recovery
program_description: For general business recovery and to offset losses during the pandemic, including a set aside for businesses that applied but did not receive funding under the Business Interruption Grant Program (BIG) and a set aside for business regrowth and renewal
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Expanding existing mental health and substance use services, and treatment and prevention programs
program_description: Expands existing mental health and substance use services, treatment, and prevention programs in priority communities in suburban Cook County in part through a community-based grants program in partnership with the Justice Advisory Council. Key areas of focus will include suicide prevention (including school-based screening), counseling and treatment, behavioral health workforce development, and youth-focused programs, including restorative justice and school discipline reform
agency: Cook County Department of Public Health
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Upgrade broadband infrastructure at all Housing Authority of Cook County (HACC) properties
program_description: This initiative will upgrade broadband infrastructure at all Housing Authority of Cook Countyowned (HACC) properties. Current network infrastructure can only support 2-3 users at a time and is inadequate to meet the needs of both staff and residents who use the communal computers. This upgrade responds to the increased need for Internet access among HACC residents and staff due to COVID-19 restrictions and will additionally address the digital divide by providing low-income residents access to high-speed Internet.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA
summary_description: Capital projects related to work, education, and health monitoring
program_description: Funds for capital projects directly enabling work, education, and health monitoring, including remote options, in response to the Covid-19 pandemic
source: U.S. Department of the Treasury

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Extension of broadband infrastructure into south suburban communities
program_description: The Chicago Southland Fiber Network provides gigabit broadband to government, education, healthcare, and businesses. Cook County will support the extension of the broadband infrastructure into south suburban communities with the highest Social Vulnerability Index (SVI) scores in the State of Illinois. Cook County will also add public WiFi access in certain anchor institutions, education institutions and government institutions that serve vulnerable communities.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Support for child advocacy centers managed by the Department of Children and Family Services
program_description: Support for child advocacy centers managed by the Department of Children and Family Services
agency: Illinois Department of Children and Family Services
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: CARES
program: Child Care and Development Block Grant
summary_description: Child assistance for low-income families
program_description: These funds supplement general revenue funds for child care assistance for low-income families. The supplemental funding must be used for activities authorized under the CCDBG Act that prevent, prepare for, and respond to the Covid-19 pandemic.
agency: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
source: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services 2020 CARES Act CCDBG Supplemental Allocations

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Commercial corridors and responsive neighborhood activation investments
summary_description: Grants and business support services to revitalize commercial corridors
program_description: Grants and business support services to revitalize commercial corridors and support new small business owners and local artists involved in beautification projects; also includes community programs to drive local participation in the planning process and workforce participation in community-driven development projects
agency: Chicago Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
program: Commercial corridors and responsive neighborhood activation investments
summary_description: Grants and business support services to revitalize commercial corridors
program_description: Grants and business support services to revitalize commercial corridors and support new small business owners and local artists involved in beautification projects; also includes community programs to drive local participation in the planning process and workforce participation in community-driven development projects
agency: Department of Planning and Development; Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Community conservation projects in local forest preserves
program_description: The Forest Preserves along with corps partners will recruit and hire up to 282 adult corps members per year from Cook County who are currently unemployed or under-employed to conduct meaningful conservation work in their local Forest Preserve. Corps members will be deployed in teams of 6 to 10 participants and supervised by experienced Field Leaders who have the technical skills to train and supervise conservation work while providing soft job skills for those new to the work force. A minimum of 75% of participants will gain at least three advanced industry skill certifications.
agency: Forest Preserves of Cook County within the Office of the President
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: CARES
summary_description: Funds available to states, metropolitan cities, urban counties, and insular areas to respond to the Covid-19 pandemic. At least 70 percent of every grant must be expended for activities that benefit low- and moderate-income persons
program_description: Funds available to states, metropolitan cities, urban counties, and insular areas to respond to the Covid-19 pandemic. At least 70 percent of every grant must be expended for activities that benefit low- and moderate-income persons by providing housing, a permanent job, a public service, or access to new or significantly improved infrastructure. The remaining 30 percent may be used to eliminate slum or blighted conditions, or to address an urgent need for which the grantee certifies it has no other funding.
agency: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
source: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development CARES Act Supplemental Funding

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Development of a Community Information Exchange (CIE) to enhance in-development 211 system
program_description: Cook County Legal Aid for Housing and Debt (CCLAHD) helps residents resolve eviction, foreclosure, consumer debt, and tax deed issues pre-court and during the court process. CCLAHD provides free legal aid, mediation services, case management, and connections for tenants and landlords dealing with evictions, property owners who are behind on their mortgage payments or property taxes, and creditors and debtors with issues related to consumer debt.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Economic development program promoting local ownership of community assets
program_description: Creates a new economic development program to promote local, democratic, and shared ownership and control of community assets; pilot investments in shared-equity models (e.g. worker cooperatives, housing cooperatives, community land trusts), giving historiclaly disinvested communities more accessible and sustainable pathways to building wealth
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Cook County Legal Aid for Housing and Debt
summary_description: Legal aid and case management services for residents facing eviction, foreclosure, consumer debt, and tax deed issues
program_description: This program helps residents resolve eviction, foreclosure, consumer debt, and tax deed issues pre-court and during the court process. Services include free legal aid, mediation services, case management, and connections for tenants and landlords dealing with evictions, property owners who are behind on their mortgage payments on property taxes, and creditors and debtors with issues related to consumer debt.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Cook County Residential Water Conservation and Energy Efficiency Program
summary_description: Utility bill cost reduction program
program_description: The program will increase housing affordability for residents by reducing utility costs. Specifically, the project identifies residents for home energy and water assessments and implement energy efficiency improvements and water conservation measures (such as window replacement, roof repairs, insulation, air sealing, HVAC improvements, LED lighting, energyefficient windows and doors, installing low-flow water appliances and repairing leaks).
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Water utility bill payment assistance
program_description: The Cook County Water Affordability Program will provide water utility bill payment assistance to help households suffering from income loss and mounting bills during the pandemic. The program will reduce uncollectable debt for municipal water utilities. The anticipated focus of the program is on communities with a high-water burden, meaning that the household spends a significantly larger portion of their income on the water and sewer bill.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

summary_description: Broad Covid-19 relief funds for state, local, and Tribal governments
program_description: This fund includes payments to State, Local, and Tribal governments navigating the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic
source: U.S. Department of the Treasury

summary_description: Creates new financing programs and tax incentives for affordable housing
program_description: Creates new financing programs and tax incentives to support the creation and preservation of affordable housing in communities across Illinois
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
summary_description: Creates mixed-use, multi-family housing developments
program_description: Creates mixed-use, multi-family housing developments in neighborhoods hardest-hit by Covid-19 through expanded investment and incentives programs
source: City of Chicago

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Development of an action plan on digital divide in suburban Cook County
program_description: To coordinate long-term digital equity work, Cook County will develop an action plan to evaluate where suburban Cook’s digital divide exists and outline solutions to cover gaps in broadband access, physical connectivity infrastructure, and financial barriers residents face when accessing digital devices and connections.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
summary_description: Forgivable loans and grants for homebuyers
program_description: Provides forgivable loans and grants to homebuyers in neighborhoods most acutely affected by the COVID-19 pandemic to expand homeownership
source: City of Chicago

legislation: ARPA
summary_description: Broad funding for statewide economic development planning
program_description: This funding supports statewide planning efforts to boost economic development, combat the climate crisis, and recover from the pandemic
source: USASpending

legislation: ARPA
program: Economic Adjustment Assistance Travel, Tourism, and Outdoor Recreation Program
summary_description: Funding for state tourism efforts
program_description: This funding supports marketing, infrastructure, workforce, and other project support to rejuvenate safe leisure, business, and international travel as part of the EDA's travel, tourism, and outdoor recreation program
source: USASpending

legislation: CARES
summary_description: Wide-ranging financial assistance for Covid-19 recovery
program_description: This investment will support Chicago in establishing the Kostner Avenue veritcal clearance improvement project to enhance industrial development potential for open space in North Lawndale, one of the city's most economically distressed neighborhoods
source: USASpending

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Funding for electric vehicle charging stations, especially in areas with large service gaps
program_description: This initiative involves four components related to increasing access to electric vehicle charging stations throughout Cook County, focusing on where there are currently large gaps in service areas, primarily in the south and west suburbs, through installing 50 Level 2 charging stations, 10 DC fast chargers, 10 Level 2 streetlight charging stations and purchasing one allelectric bus and wireless charger installation to pilot at the Department of Corrections Campus.
agency: Cook County Department of Transportation and Highways
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Support for residents behind on mortgage payments
program_description: The Emergency Mortgage Assistance Program will provide funds to support residents who are behind on mortgage, insurance escrow, and residential real estate tax escrow payments. The program will also fund additional housing services supports to offset foreclosure and further increase household stability.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Emergency re-entry voucher program for people leaving Cook County jail and transitioning into housing
program_description: The Justice Advisory Council will administer emergency re-entry vouchers to assist people leaving Cook County Jail in securing safe housing. Currently, approximately 1,100 people in Cook County are kept behind bars after their release date because they cannot find affordable housing.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: CRRSAA
summary_description: Funds for emergency rental housing, including rent and utility assistance and case management
program_description: These funds support emergency rental housing. At least 90 percent of awarded funds must be used for direct financial assistance, including rent, rental arrears, utilities and home energy costs, utilities and home energy costs arrears, and other expenses related to housing. Remaining funds are available for housing stability services, including case management and other services intended to keep households stably housed.
source: U.S. Department of the Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program Payments/USA Spending

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Rental and utility assistance, as well as housing services to offset evictions
program_description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program will provide funds to support residents who are behind on rent, utilities, and household expenses and will cover forward rent to support renter household stability. The program will also fund additional housing services and supports to offset evictions and further increase household stability. Cook County will administer this program in partnership with the Housing Authority of Cook County.

summary_description: Community-driven development near transit
program_description: Advance local housing, public health, climate resiliency and economic recovery goals by supporting community-driven development near transit to foster healthy, walkable, affordable, and accessible communities
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

summary_description: Funds for establishing, expanding, and sustaining public health workforces
program_description: These funds can be used to carry out activities related to establishing, expanding, and sustaining a public health workforce employed by state or local public health departments or non-profit, private, or public organizations with demonstrated expertise in implementing public health programs. Public health departments employ contact tracers, nurses, epidemiologists, community health workers.

program: Fixed-Site Emergency Shelter for People Experiencing Homelessness
summary_description: Shelter services for people experiencing homelessness
program_description: The Bureau of Economic Development will support organizations within the Cook County Continuum of Care to stand up fixed-site shelter in 5-7 locations to provide health and safety to people in a housing crisis who cannot be diverted from homelessness. These organizations will also provide shelter services to ensure their experience of homelessness is short by reconnecting them to housing and other supports.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Recurring monthly unrestricted payments to a to-be-defined set of residents for at least 12 months to improve participants’ long-term economic stability
program_description: The Cook County Guaranteed Income Program will provide recurring monthly unrestricted payments to a to-be-defined set of residents for at least 12 months to improve participants’ long-term economic stability. The Guaranteed Income Program builds on the demonstrated success of guaranteed income programs in other jurisdictions in increasing residents’ financial stability and improving their health outcomes. Cook County’s program will include a research evaluation component to help the County better understand participant impacts.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Expanding the Gun Crimes Strategy Unit's outreach efforts
program_description: The Gun Crimes Strategies Unit (GCSU) embeds Assistant State's Attorneys in six of the most violent police districts in Chicago. Expansion of the Gun Crimes Strategies Unit will allow the Cook County State's Attorney's Office to expand the reach and efforts of the GCSU in order to help combat the rise in violence and shootings within the City and the South Suburbs.
agency: Cook County State's Attorney's Office Gun Crimes Strategies Unit
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA
summary_description: Head Start promotes school readiness of infants, toddlers, and pre-school-aged children from low-income families

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Funding for Healing Hurt People, a trauma-informed violence intervention program
program_description: Healing Hurt People (HHP) is a trauma-informed violence intervention program for survivors of urban intentional violence. HHP works to advance the notion that unaddressed psychological trauma is a key driver of the cycle of violence, fueled by the structural violence of racism and stigma. HHP Chicago's goals are to reduce re-injury, retaliation, and criminal justice involvement by having a positive impact on trauma recovery, mental health, and drug use, and help participants achieve independence, work, education, and create a strong future.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Funding to help prevent mortgage delinquency, defaults, foreclosures, loss of utilities or home energy services, or homeowner displacement
program_description: Provides funding to help prevent mortgage delinquency, defaults, foreclosures, loss of utilities or home energy services, or the displacement of homeowners experiencing financial hardships
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA
summary_description: Funds to assist homeowners with delinquent mortgage payments
program_description: This program provides relief for vulnerable homeowners. The law prioritizes homeowners who have experienced the greatest hardships, leveraging local and national income indicators to maximize intended impact. Funds can be used to make delinquent mortgage payments. States must request funds and will receive funds based on their unemployment rate, number of mortgages in foreclosure, and number of mortgages that are past due.
source: U.S. Department of Treasury Homeowner Assistance Fund Allocations

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Hotel-based sheltering for people experiencing homelessness
program_description: The Bureau of Economic Development will continue the hotel-based sheltering approach implemented during the pandemic, when the existing PADS model of shelter with congregate shelter in rotating church basements was no longer viable
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Increase access to broadband internet connection
summary_description: Neighborhood-scale broadband investments
program_description: Expands Chicago Connected by funding neighborhood-scale broadband and leverage City assets to increase broadband affordability in communities
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
program: Increase access to broadband internet connection
summary_description: Neighborhood-scale broadband investments
program_description: Expands Chicago Connected by funding neighborhood-scale broadband and leverage City assets to increase broadband affordability in communities
source: City of Chicago

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Expanding a grant program for transportation infrastructure projects
program_description: Invest in Cook is an existing grant program that annually awards $8.5 million to communities to advance local transportation infrastructure projects that implement the priorities of the County's long-range transportation plan and support economic outcomes
agency: Cook County Department of Transportation and Highways
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Workforce developpment and community service programming in suburban Cook County
program_description: Cook County will provide support to workforce and training programs that offer young adults quality paid work experiences to explore career pathways in target sectors or provide opportunities for a “community service corps”. The County will also support the expansion of workforce development programs that serve hard to engage populations including people without stable housing, youth in care and graduates of foster care system, people with disabilities, returning residents, and pregnant and parenting youth. Program resources will support residents of suburban Cook County.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Develop a criminal justice report outlining strategies to minimize overspending
program_description: The Justice Advisory Council will engage consultants to review Cook County's criminal justice budgets and develop a report with 1) an overview of current spending; 2) an outline of duplicative efforts or overspending; 3) a strategy to make reductions in criminal justice spending and invest in community; and 4) best practices from jurisdictions that have successfully reinvested criminal justice dollars into public health and community resources.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Lead pipe removal at Vera Yates Homes and Richard Flowers Home
summary_description: Removal of remaining lead water pipes at two Housing Authority of Cook County (HACC) affordable family housing properties
program_description: This initiative will remove remaining lead water pipes at two Housing Authority of Cook County (HACC) affordable family housing properties: the Vera Yates Homes in Ford Heights and the Richard Flowers Homes in Robbins. This funding will allow HACC to remove all lead pipes at each of these properties, preventing children living at these sites from suffering irreparable, life-long neurological damage associated with lead exposure, and provide all residents of these developments a healthier, safer living environment.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Lead, leaking, and obsolete service line replacement pilot program
summary_description: Management for lead, leaking, and obsolete service line replacements in high-risk communities
program_description: Cook County will work in partnership with municipal water utilities to oversee and manage lead, leaking, and obsolete service line replacement across Cook County. This program will target high-risk communities, including improvements to individual homes, and high-risk facilities, including preschools, daycare centers, home daycare providers, group daycare homes, parks, playgrounds, hospitals and clinics.
agency: Cook County Bureau of Economic Development
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA
program: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program
summary_description: Provides home energy bill assistance
program_description: The Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) provides assistance in managing costs associated with home energy bills, energy crises, weatherization and energy-related minor home repairs
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: CARES
program: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program

source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA
program: Low Income Household Water Assistance Program
summary_description: Assists low-income households with affordable drinking water and wastewater services
program_description: The Low Income Household Water Assistance Program will assist low-income households, particularly those with the lowest incomes and that pay a high proportion of household income for drinking water and wastewater services, by providing funds to owners or operators of public water systems or treatment works to reduce arrearages of and rates charged to low-income households for water and wastewater services.
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

summary_description: Investments in neighborhood park improvements
program_description: Investments in neighborhood park improvements, including beautification, expansion of recreation and accessibility
source: City of Chicago

summary_description: Expands hotel and lodging building programs
program_description: Expands program to utilize former hotel and lodging buildings for use as permanent supportiev housing
source: City of Chicago

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Assistance for convention centers and visitors bureaus
program_description: Funds for convention centers and visitors bureaus
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: General grants and funds for alleviating financial impacts on agencies and industries
program_description: Other grants and funds for agencies and industries impacted financially by the Covid-19 pandemic
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Violence prevention programs
program_description: These funds support violence prevention programs
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
summary_description: Loans and grants for home rehabilitation
program_description: Provides forgivable loans and grants to qualified homeowners for rehab and repair services that will help them safely remain in their homes
source: City of Chicago

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
summary_description: Public broadband at fieldhouses
program_description: Investments in public broadband network at field houses for use by community residents
source: City of Chicago

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
summary_description: New permanent supportive housing units
program_description: Creates new units for permanent supportive housing across newly rehabilitated housing buildings
source: City of Chicago

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Permanent supportive housing for people experiencing homelessness
summary_description: Creation of 250 permanent supportive housing units
program_description: Cook County will create 250 new units of permanent supportive housing, a nationally recognized best practice for ending homelessness. Permanent supportive housing is a housing model that pairs non-time-limited rental subsidies with individualized, intensive, supportive services to help households maintain independent living and housing stability.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Programs and services for domestic violence victims and survivors
summary_description: Grants for providers serving domestic violence survivors
program_description: The Offices Under the President will administer grants to providers that serve survivors of domestic violence. Domestic violence advocates have requested this funding to support legal resources, mental health resources, and rapid housing resources for domestic violence victims and survivors.
agency: Cook County Offices Under the President
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Legal services for the Roseland/South Chicago and West Garfield Park/Humboldt Park communities
program_description: Provides robust legal services to two Cook County communities that have been disproportionately affected by COVID-19, incarceration, and gun violence--greater Roseland/South Chicago and greater West Garfield Park/Humboldt Park. The Community Defense Center will work predominantly with African American and Latinx communities, providing legal services, community empowerment, advocacy and education.
agency: Law Office of the Cook County Public Defender
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Stormwater management programs in high flood-risk communities
program_description: Cook County partnered with the Center for Neighborhood Technology to create a Rain Ready plan for the Calumet Corridor, which includes Blue Island, Calumet City, Calumet Park, Dolton, Riverdale, and Robbins and has a history of both disinvestment and flooding. The Department of Environment and Sustainability will put these six communities on a path towards greater resilience by implementing many of the recommended projects to improve stormwater management through green infrastructure and sustainable economic development.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Rehousing and wraparound services for people at risk of homelessness and domestic violence
program_description: Provides funds for people at risk of homelessness, including those at risk of domestic violence, to access rehousing services and wraparound services en route to permanent housing solutions
agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services
source: City of Chicago

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Funding for community-based organizations to provide rental and security deposit assistance
program_description: The Justice Advisory Council will fund Cook County community-based organizations to provide rental assistance, security deposit assistance, and outreach counseling to justice-involved individuals. The initiative will also explore more effective housing strategies, partnerships and supports to connect these individuals to stable and permanent housing thus helping to reduce recidivism.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Expands workforce training opportunities for formerly incarcerated individuals
program_description: Expands workforce training opportunities for formerly incarcerated individuals to attain employment and other stabilization services
agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Resources for community safety initiatives and violence reduction initiatives
summary_description: Violence reduction and community safety programs
program_description: Funds a comprehensive set of programs including operational support and staffing for the CSCC, communications and marketing for violence prevention and reduction, expansion of resources for violence intervention programming and support for community groups
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: Chicago General Obligation Bond
summary_description: Repairs and renovations to homeless shelters
program_description: Repair and make critical renovations to Chicago's homeless shelters, including conversion into non-congregate housing
agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services
source: City of Chicago

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Small Business Assistance Program & One Stop Shop
summary_description: Advising services, webinars, and recovery grants for small businesses
program_description: The Small Business Assistance Program supports a coordinated network of over 30 partners that provide one-on-one business advising, webinars, and recovery grants. New funding will further build the capacity of partners to deliver services, increase availability of services in suburban Cook, and support the establishment of a Cook County “One-Stop Small Business Service Center.”
agency: Cook County Bureau of Economic Development
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Grants to small businesses with less than 20 employees and early-stage businesses impacted by Covid-19
program_description: Grants to small businesses with less than 20 employees that continue to suffer from the impacts of COVID-19, as well as early-stage businesses formed since the onset of COVID-19. The grants will position businesses for growth and a sustainable path forward.
agency: Cook County Bureau of Economic Development
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Creates a new sobering center facility as an alternative to emergency rooms and jails for publicly intoxicated individuals
program_description: Creates a new facility to enhance public safety and health outcomes by providing an alternative to emergency rooms and jails for publicly intoxicated individuals to initiate recovery
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA
summary_description: Programs supporting businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged entrepreneurs
program_description: This program includes: $1.5 billion for states to support businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged entrepreneurs; $1 billion for an incentive program to boost funding tranches for states that show robust support for these businesses; and $500 million to support very small businesses with fewer than 10 employees. This law will inject capital into state small business support and capital access programs, provide collateral support, facilitate loan participation, and enable credit guarantee programs.
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Funding for violent gun crime investigation and prosecution
program_description: This request will assist the Cook County State's Attorney's Office in investigating and prosecuting violent gun crimes. The State’s Attorney’s Office will use funding to add Investigators to the unit to work with prosecutors (state and federal, law enforcement agencies, etc.) and other stakeholders to help ensure public safety in communities across Cook County.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Stormwater management programs in high flood-risk communities
program_description: Cook County will provide funding to the Metropolitan Water Reclamation District of Greater Chicago (MWRD) to support stormwater management in communities that experience significant flooding. This funding will allow MWRD to expand beyond funding to include overall responsibility for stormwater management project implementation since local capacity constraints currently limit the existing program's impact.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Workforce opportunities in commercial development
program_description: Creates workforce opportunities for engagement along corridors to ensure safety, cleanliness, and local participation in commercial development processes
agency: Chicago Department of Planning and Development; Department of Business Affiairs and Consumer Protection
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
program: Strengthening Chicago's youth juvenile justice collaborative expansion
summary_description: Violence-reduction and juvenile justice programming for youth at high risk of exposure to violence
program_description: This project aims to reduce violence and minimize justice involvement of youth who have experienced violence or trauma or are at high risk of exposure to violence. Services include trauma-informed care coordination for 500 justice-involved youth per year over three years, including youth on diversion (arrested for a felony or violent misdemeanor) or youth granted deferred prosecution. Services include intake, assessment, connection to evidence-based programming and pro-social services, emergency assistance, family support services, and postdischarge monitoring. In addition to providing care coordination and direct services for youth and their families, funds will support data tracking and analysis, continuous quality improvement, and developing an evaluation plan.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Youth workforce development programs
program_description: Progams that support youth in developing workplace skills and gaining employment experience
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Establishing and expanding apprenticeship programs
program_description: As a designated Apprenticeship Navigator by the Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity, Cook County will support the establishment of new apprenticeships or expansions of existing apprenticeships in suburban Cook County. The Bureau of Economic Development will fund eligible partners and Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity intermediaries to sponsor and manage apprenticeship programs, conduct industry engagement, provide technical assistance to businesses, and support apprentices' progress.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Funds for the Supporting Education and Employment Development (SEED) Program, a plea-diversion and case management program
program_description: The Justice Advisory Council will provide funds to sustain and expand the Supporting Education and Employment Development (SEED) Program, a 13-month pre-plea diversion program for individuals aged 18 to 30, charged with possession with intent to deliver or manufacturing/delivery of a substance. The program provides case management, educational services, trauma-informed and cognitive behavioral interventions, job readiness training, job development and placement, supported employment, and restorative justice activities. The successful completion of the program results in case dismissal and expungement at graduation.
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Increasing affordable and supportive housing supply
program_description: Increasing the supply of affordable housing and supportive housing and addressing homelessness to build stronger communities
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

program_description: These funds are supplemental appropriations to existing highway infrastructure programs

program: Targeted financial and legal assistance for underserved residents
summary_description: Financial assistance programs for underserved communities, including monthly cash assistance
program_description: Creates immediate financial assistance programs for underserved communities such as undocumented residents, domestic workers, and small community-based nonprofits providing safety net services; pilot a monthly cash assistance program for hard-hit, low-income households in need of additional economic stability; expand legal assistance programs through the Legal Protection Fund and Community Justice Initiative
agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services, Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection

program: The Research in Illinois to Spur Economic Recovery Program (RISE)

program_description: Grants to help local governments and economic development organizations to create or update economic plans to promote economic recovery
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Press Release

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Community engagement and cultural projects
program_description: Support for projects that utilize community engagement to produce cultural projects including community-led public art installations, historical walking tours, neighborhood and educational websites, pop up galleries, and other cultural activations
agency: Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events
source: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Tourism programming
program_description: Funds supporting the Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity's tourism grants, including the Main Street Festival Grant
agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

legislation: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
summary_description: Economic and community development planning
program_description: Cook County will identify high vulnerability communities and co-design a process to meet community-defined needs for economic development, community building, community safety, public health, education or social services. The County will support communities over a sustained period to ensure implementation and capacity-building, as well as helping attract additional public, private, and philanthropic resources.
agency: Cook County Bureau of Economic Development; Cook County Equity Fund Taskforce
source: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

summary_description: Implementation of extended unemployment insurance
program_description: These funds support implementation of extended unemployment insurance

summary_description: IT and digital service team investments

Services include direct street-level intervention, mentoring, basic needs assistance, educational and vocational programming, and behavioral health and wellness support.

source: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

summary_description: Implementation of a new youth diversion model
program_description: Implementation of a new youth deflection and diversion model, including facility/space needs and social services

summary_description: Creates and expands youth career programs
